N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 8.2 - Waiver of road test

State Regulations

In addition to any other tests required, an applicant for a
license, other than a renewal license, shall be required to pass a road test in
a vehicle appropriate to the type of license for which application is made, except that such road test requirement shall be waived: (a) if the applicant was formerly a resident
of another state, the District of Columbia, Guam, Puerto Rico, the Canal Zone
or a province of Canada and has become a resident of this State, and is or was, within two years prior to the date of application for a New York license, the
holder of a valid license issued by the motor vehicle authority of his former
residence; or
(b) if the applicant
is applying for an original license after revocation of a prior New York
license, provided that application is made within two years from the date
subject was last validly licensed in this State; or
(c) if the applicant is applying for a
commercial drivers license and such applicant demonstrates that s/he meets the
requirements set forth in
49
CFR
383.77, in relation to drivers with
military experience in the operation of a representative commercial motor
vehicle; (d) incorporation of
certain Federal regulations by reference. The provisions of the

Code of

Federal Regulations
which have been incorporated by reference in this

Part have been filed in the Office of the Secretary of State of the State of

New York, the publications so filed being the booklets entitled

Code of

Federal Regulations, title 49, parts 383.3, 383.51 383.77, and
383.113, published by the Office of the Federal Register, National Archives and

Records Administration. The regulations incorporated by reference may be
examined at the Office of the Department of State, One Commerce Plaza, 99

Washington Avenue, Albany, NY 12231, at the New York State Supreme Court Law

Libraries, the Legislative Library, the New York State Department of Motor

Vehicles, Office of Counsel, 6 Empire State Plaza, Albany, NY 12228. They may
also be purchased from the Superintendent of Documents, Government Printing

Office, Washington, DC 20402. Copies of the

Code of Federal

Regulations
are also available at many public libraries and bar
association libraries. Notes
